resources.string: This app allows you to search for medication by the symptom you are experiencing.

string-array.name: symptom_description
string-array.item: An elevation of body temperature above the normal range of 97.7–99.5 °F (36.5–37.5 °C).
Pain anywhere in the region of the head or neck.
Sudden and often repetitively occurring reflex which helps to clear the large breathing passages from secretions, irritants, foreign particles and microbes.

A viral infectious disease of the upper respiratory tract which affects primarily the nose. Symptoms include coughing, sore throat, runny nose, sneezing, and fever which usually resolve in seven to ten days, with some symptoms lasting up to three weeks.
Caused by the influenza viruses. The most common symptoms are chills, fever, runny nose, sore throat, muscle pains, headache (often severe), coughing, weakness/fatigue and general discomfort.
